content.description:
A wide leaning offwidth that narrows down to fists at the top. Still dirty and needs scrubbed. Can be top roped from the Lawnboy anchor.

CAUTION! WATCH THE END OF THE ROPE OR USE A 70M. TIE KNOTS!!
content.location: The 1st obvious wide crack at the bottom end of the cliff. Left of Lawnboy.

content.description:
An awesome climb, maybe the best here. Start up with easy slabby moves to below a bulge. Creep through the buldge and pull a cruxy move on small edges from a good stance. Move left around a little corner and up onto the arete.

70M ONLY!! WATCH THE END OF YOUR ROPE! TIE KNOTS!
content.protection: bolts to a chain anchor. 70m rope
content.location: This route is uphill from "Dog who stole things" and left of "Runaway Jim". Look for the sun shadowed arete.

content.description:
Also maybe the best route here, and the most technically difficult. Begin with easy slabby moves and work up through a series of small ledges and 2 short cracks. Halfway begins the harder moves with a short run out when laybacking the 1st crack (optional small/medium cam). The last moves are quite thrilling.

70M ONLY! WATCH THE END OF YOUR ROPE! TIE KNOTS!
content.protection: bolts to a chain anchor, 70m rope. (Optional medium cam)
content.location: Farthest uphill route at the cliff. To the right of Sleeping Monkey.

content.description:
CAUTION!!    WATCH THE END OF THE ROPE!! MUST USE A 70M AND BELAY UPHILL ABOVE FROM AXILLA!! DO NOT TOP ROPE BELAY FROM BELOW. TIE KNOTS!!

The main, tallest feature of the cliff and the 2nd route climbed here. The striking leaning crack center of the wall, next to the base of the big blocky pillar. Still a little dirty and needs more excavation. It can be top roped after climbing Axilla. Must use a 70m rope and belay from base of axilla. Tie knots!!
content.protection: Variety of cams, mostly wide, or TR. 70m rope
content.location: Center of the wall, next to the large blocky pillar that Splits the lower wall from the upper wall. To the right of Lawnboy and left of Axilla.

content.description:
The 1st route climbed here. Slabby climbing with good friction and horizontal edges.

A little move off the ground to the 1st bolt, then a short cruxy slab move to get to the 3rd bolt. Easy enjoyable climbing above.

WATCH THE END OF YOUR ROPE! TIE KNOTS!
content.protection: bolts to a chain anchor, 60m rope
content.location: The 1st route to the right of the wide offwidth at the bottom end of the cliff (weekapaug Groove), Which can be top roped from this anchor.

content.description: A fun route with good moves on horizontal edges and slabby dishes. Probably the easiest route here.
content.protection: bolts to a chain anchor, 60m rope
content.location: This route is uphill behind the large pine tree and blocky pillar. To the right of Axilla, and left of Sleeping Monkey.

content.description: A challenging slabby route with small holds and good thought provoking moves.
content.protection: bolts to a chain anchor, 60m rope
content.location: This route is uphill behind the large pine tree, to the right of "Rift" and left of "dog who stole things". It has an airy start off the top of the large boulder, that sits atop the blocky pillar in the middle of the cliff.
